metadata.title: CVE-2021-47609 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:firmware: arm_scpi: Fix string overflow in SCPI genpd driverWithout the bound checks for scpi_pd->name, it could result in the bufferoverflow when copying the SCPI device name from the corresponding devicetree node as the name string is set at maximum size of 30.Let us fix it by using devm_kasprintf so that the string buffer isallocated dynamically.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47609` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
